data.title: Obituaries Pearl River
data.meta_description: Get complete funeral services at Williams Funeral Home in Pearl River, LA. View our list of obituaries and learn the life stories of these amazing individuals.
data.text:
Williams, Doris

On Wednesday, October 11, 2023, Doris Herrin Williams, age 83 of Pearl River, La., passed on peacefully to be with our Lord. She was a wonderful woman to be around and loved spending as much time as she could with her family.

Mrs. Doris leaves to cherish her memory her 2 children, Gail (Timmy) and Linda (Louis), 2 brothers, Ed (Polly) and Glen (Cathy), 8 precious grandchildren; Cindy (Ben), Crystal (Thomas), Kimberly (Jason), Kenneth, Christine (Jose), Devon “Boo Boo”, Allen (Ethel), and Joseph, 18 great-grandchildren; Jenna, Emersen, Graham, Joseph, Caden, Gracie, Adalynn, Kenneth Jr., Layal Isabella, Evangeline, Amaya, Lorena, Sophia, Myla, Malia, Allen Jr., and Emily, and her great great-grandson Grayson. She is now walking the streets of gold with her husband, Joseph E. Williams, her parents, Mack and Ruth Herrin, 3 children, Luther “Bubba” Williams, Penny Sue Williams and Debra Williams, 2 brothers, Elwood Herrin and Charles, and a half-brother, Norman Evans. Her legacy will live on through all who knew and loved her.

Funeral services for Mrs. Doris will be held on Saturday, October 14, 2023, at 1:00 pm from the chapel of D.T. Williams Funeral Home, 67525 Hwy. 41, Pearl River, La, with visitation on Saturday from 11:00 am until 1:00 pm.

Interment to follow at Turtleskin Cemetery, Picayune, Ms.

Bro. Brad Heffner to be officiating.

Bourgeois, Bertha

On Friday October 6, 2023, Bertha Belle Bourgeois, age 93 of Slidell, LA was called to be with our Lord in Heaven with her loving children by her side. Ms. Bertha was a loving woman who enjoyed reading romance novels, doing puzzle books, watching the Saints play, and getting as many walks in as she could. She is survived by her children Rebecca Eaton and Brian Bourgeois (Edit), her grandchildren; Vincent Bourgeois, Natasha Bourgeois, Sheryl Aucoin, Michael Amedio, and Jennifer Presnell, and her great grandchildren Aydin Aucoin and Lawson Amedio. She is now reunited with her husband Floyd Bourgeois, her parents Adam and Elia Daigle, and her sister Margie Ann Spann. She will be missed greatly. Visitation for Bertha will be held on Friday October 13, 2023, from 10 am to 12 pm with mass starting at 12 pm at St. Luke the Evangelist Church 910 Cross Gates Blvd., Slidell, LA 70461. She will be laid to rest next to her husband at the Biloxi National Cemetery in a private ceremony.

Ivy, Jolynn

On Tuesday, October 10, 2023, Jolynn Ivy, age 74 of Slidell, LA passed away peacefully in her own home surrounded by her loving family. Jolynn loved shopping and was a huge Walt Disney fanatic. She will be missed greatly. She is survived by her loving husband of 52 years, Bo Ivy, her daughters Amy S. Ivy Geiman (Wes, Sr.), and Amanda Lynn Ivy (Brian McGaha), her brother George Johnston (Jean), 5 grandchildren; Matthew Voiron (Macayla), Wesley Geiman, Jr., Logan Geiman, Hope Geiman, and Sarah Geiman, her great grandchild Jordan Disparo, and a host of step grandchildren, step great grandchildren, and a host of nieces, and nephews. Jolynn is now reunited with her parents Edward and Dorothy Johnston. Memorial Services will be held at a later date.

Maxwell, Jr., Eugene "Bootlegger"

Colon, Margaret "Peggy"

On Thursday, April 20,2023, Margaret “Peggy” Ann Colon, age 76 of Pearl River, LA, passed away with her loving husband, Joe and her three devoted children, Missy, Richard and Shelly at her side as she went peacefully to our Lord in heaven. Peggy was born September 29, 1946 in Rutland, Vermont, daughter of Peter Alexander Badgewick and Margaret Ann Kent. Peggy was raised in Rutland and attended Mount Saint Joseph Academy where she graduated from in 1964.

After graduating from high school, she enrolled in Fanny Allen Memorial School of Practical Nursing and graduated in 1967 as a LPN. Peggy continued her nursing education at Kings County Hospital School of Nursing in Brooklyn, New York and was honored in her graduating class of 1970. She became a licensed Registered Nurse in New York in 1970 and then in Louisiana in 1973. She had an accomplished career as a cardiac-telemetry RN, working at De La Ronde Medical Center in Chalmette, LA, Methodist Hospital in NOLA, and Slidell Memorial Hospital in Slidell, LA until she retired from nursing after 40 plus years of service. Peggy married in New York, had two of her three children, Missy and Richard and in the early 1970’s moved to Southeast Louisiana where she had her third child, Shelly, in 1975. Peggy was a dedicated, loving mother, filled with adventure and an overwhelming joy for daily life in addition to making special memories. On February 4, 1995, Peggy married Joseph R. Colon and spent over thirty years with her loving husband and best friend. As a couple, Peggy and Joe delighted in making lifetime memories, traveling and cruising the Caribbean Islands, being involved with their blended family and being fun-loving grandparents, enjoying the camping life with longtime friends and making new friends along the way. Peggy and Joe were devoted members of the Pearl River Methodist Church community and Peggy enjoyed many friendships and fellowships through her Christian works at church functions and fundraising events. Peggy was a participant and advocate for Celebrating Recovery through her church community. She embraced life, shared her “life” quotes when needed, loved with all her heart, danced with joy, had no filter when giving advice, enjoyed going to the matinee movies and bringing her own movie snacks while laughing out of control or sharing loud outburst with other movie goers, best deviled egg maker, delighted in bike rides, night walks guided by flashlights with her kids, grandkids, and great-grandkids,

Dollar-Tree shopping sprees, bandaging a family or friend’s injury and always making sure family/friends birthdays were recognized and celebrated. Peggy was a passionate photographer who loved capturing the moment. Her thousands of photo collections have documented so many of our life events, routine daily activities, years of holidays and cheers. She was Instagram even before the internet. Peggy shared the gift of her life by always being present in the lives of her family and friends. She served others through her strengths and struggles with grace, gratitude, kindness, and love. She is survived by her devoted husband, Joseph R. Colon, her loving children; daughter, Melissa D. Valenti, son in law, Dominick Valenti, and granddaughter Madison Reed, grandson in law, Tyler Reed, and great granddaughters, Jaylen, Magnolia, and Josephine Reed; and granddaughter, Miah Fontenot, grandson in law, Connor Fontenot, and great grandson, Casey Fontenot; son, Richard F. Dean II, daughter in law, Sheila Vaughn Dean, granddaughter, Ashley Dean and fiancé Cody Olsen, great-grandson, Jace Garlepied; grandson,

Justin Dean, granddaughter, Courtney Dean, and grandson, Ryan Dean; Peggy’s youngest daughter, Shelly Dean Young, son in law, Robbie Young, grandson, Nicholas Young and granddaughter in law, Lauren Young, great-grandson, Knox Young; granddaughter, Montana Young and grandson, Peyton Young. Also survived by Howie Colon and Brandi Doll, grandson, Devin Colon; Maria Colon and Jeffery Smith, granddaughter Brooke Andrews, grandson in law, Bradley Andrews, great granddaughter, Mason Andrews, great grandson, Evander Andrews; granddaughter, Payton Colon, great granddaughters, Gabriella and Viviana Colon, and great grandsons, Jayden and Taysom Jordan; grandson and granddaughter in law, Dawson Smith and Jessica Coglaiti, great granddaughters, Aubree and Layla Smith; grandson Caden Smith. Our mother, Memaw, wife, aunt, and friend will be missed beyond measure. Please come celebrate Peggy’s life of love and friendship at Pearl River Methodist Church @ 65480 LA-41 Pearl River,

LA 70452 on Saturday, May 13, 2023 @ 3pm for the church memorial service and Peggy’s love for cake and coffee to immediately follow for her celebration of life fellowship with family and friends. Peggy’s favorite color was purple; Lets represent with a sea of purple in her loving honor on Saturday, May 13th. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Fairchild, Michael

On Wednesday April 26th, 2023, Michael Fairchild age 67 of Bay St. Louis, MS, passed away peacefully. Michael attended Shoreline Park Baptist Church in Bay St Louis, MS, and loved going fishing in his free time. He is survived by his sons; Michael Landry (Heather), Matthew Landry (Carolee), Joshua Fairchild (Cori) and Cody Fairchild, his siblings; Katherine James (Gary), Lofton Fairchild (Patty), and James Weathers (Debra) and his grandchildren Kayleigh Fairchild, Braelyn Fairchild, Joshua Fairchild Jr., Gavin Landry, and Kylee Adams. Michael is preceded in death by his parents Lofton and Kathleen Fairchild and his grandson who he adored Gabriel P Fairchild. Memorial Services will be held on Saturday May 13, 2023, at Celebration Church – Metairie Campus located at 2001 Airline hwy. Metairie La, 70001 with Visitation at 9 am and Service at 11 am. All Family and friends are welcome to attended.

Mahan, Brittany

On Tuesday April 25, 2023, Brittany Kassandra Mahan, age 31 of Pearl River, LA went to be with our Lord in the comfort of her home. Brittany was an amazing young woman with a beautiful soul. Brittany had a passion for helping others that were in need. She stayed very involved with her family and friends. She enjoyed making special tokens for her loved ones, especially her nieces and nephews. She was a fabulous cook who loved cooking family favorite recipes that were passed down to her. Brittany was a very talented decorator. Her greatest and most proud accomplishment was her Degree in Applied Science in Coding and Billing.

Brittany leaves behind her Mother, Shannon Mahan, her siblings; Kelvin (Samantha) and Cadey Mahan (Michael Messina); her Grandparents, Marilyn Gaines (Singletary), Barbara and Herman Necaise, Tim and Tammy Kinchen, and Donna and Shane Barnes; Her Great Grandmother Lois Singletary; She is also survived by her Uncles and Aunts; Scotty Kinchen, Joseph Sims (Sherri), Caleb Kinchen, Melissa Mahan, Holly Kinchen, Anna Stringer, Jessica Jenevie, Rachael McLain (Bobby), Cheryl and Raymond Sharp, Sue and Ed Crosby, Mary and Mannie Woods, and Jamie Kennedy. Nieces and nephews; Hailey Gilmore, Bentley and Brantley Ducre, Elijah, Adilynn, Silas and Wyatt John Messina, Noah, Arlo and Luka Mahan. First Cousins; Hunter and Bentley Craft, Elliot Nunez, Sara and Mary Kinchen, Jack Gillikin, Presley Sims, Jason Kennedy, Shelby Guttuso, Alena and William Barnes; her most loved Henley Family, Prent Blackwell, Raven and Violet Penton, and her very special friend Jeff Miller, and host of very special family and friends. Brittany is preceded in death and is now reunited in Heaven with her Father, Kenneth Ray Mahan; Great Grandfather Gene Mahan, Great Grandmother Shirley Bennett Mahan, Grandfather Gerald Mahan, Uncle Kenneth Glenn Mahan, Uncle Gerald Wayne Mahan (Little Wayne), and Uncle Eugene Ray Mahan, Great Grandfather Huey Little Singletary, and her Gramps Milton John “Jack” Gaines. Our Brittany was so beautiful inside and out and brought such joy to her mother, Family, and Friends. We will all miss her and will forever hold her memory close to our hearts.

Funeral Services to celebrate Brittany’s life will be held on Tuesday May 2, 2023, at 1 pm with visitation from 11 am until service time at 1 pm from the chapel of Williams Funeral Home 67525 Hwy 41, Pearl River, LA 70452. Brother Billy Trusley to be officiating. Interment to follow at Audubon Cemetery, Pearl River, LA.

Ryan, II, Robert

On Saturday April 22, 2023, Robert Wayne Ryan, II, age 48 of Pearl River, LA

passed away to be with the Lord. He loved playing dominos with his family and friends, loved fishing, but his favorite past time was playing with his grandbabies. Bobby is survived by his wife Judy Caputo, his daughter Alyssa Ryan-Caillouet (Chad), his parents April Sicks and Robert Ryan, Sr., grandchildren Addalyn Rose and Avery Rae, his sister Faith Rowley, grandparents Audrey England and Robert Lee Ryan, and a host of aunts, uncles, and cousins. He is preceded in death by his uncle Joey Ryan and his cousin Steven Ryan. He will be missed dearly. Funeral services will be held on Saturday, April 29, 2023 from 11:30 AM until 12:30 PM with the funeral service starting at 12:30 PM at Williams Funeral Home, 67525 Hwy. 41, Pearl River, LA. Interment to follow at Austin Cemetery, Pearl River, LA. Brother Robbie Wells to be officiating.

McDonald, Jennifer

On Saturday April 22, 2023 Jennifer Lynne McDonald, age 53 of Bush, LA passed away peacefully after her battle with cancer. Jennifer was a member of Celebration Church, was a professional Artist, and a dedicated school bus driver for 23 years. She was an amazing woman and will be remembered by all who knew her. Jennifer is survived by her husband Scott McDonald, her children Preston McCarra and Shelby Cambre (Gregory), her parents Willis “Jon” Harkreader and Margo Harkreader, her brother Alan Harkreader, and her grandchildren Trenton, Abrianna, and Kimberly. Memorial Services will be set at a later date. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Hardy, Donnie

Donnie Ruby Hardy of Slidell, LA passed away on Wednesday April 12, 2023, at the age of 57. Her memory will continue to be cherished here on Earth by her mother Deborah Holm Roberts, her father Billy Hardy, Brother Jeff Hardy, son Benjamin Roberts (Brittany), nephew Jeffery Hardy, grandchildren Brielle Roberts, Anthony Fricke and Trace Fricke. She was preceded in death by her grandmother Delorah Stringer Holm, grandfather Buddy Holm, sister Jennifer Passaro, and best friend Shadow. She was very fond of beautiful sunrises, the mountains, and spending time outside gardening. She will be missed greatly. Funeral services for Donnie will be held on Saturday April 22, 2023, at 2:30 pm with visitation from 12:30 pm until service time from the chapel of Williams Funeral Home 67525 Hwy 41, Pearl River, LA 70452. Interment to follow at Hickory Memorial Gardens Cemetery, Pearl River, LA.

Bonck, Thomas

On Saturday April 15, 2023, Thomas Charles Bonck, age 67 of New Orleans, LA passed away peacefully to be with our Lord. Tommy worked in sales for many years, and loved playing golf every weekend that he could. He will be missed greatly by all who knew him. He is survived by his children Jennifer Nicole Furlan (Ben), Erica Elizabeth Olmstead (Kevin), and Thomas Alexander “Alex” Bonck (Lacey), grandchildren Talia DeLassus, Sophia Salpietra, and Kirk Bruckhart II, his sister Andrea Hawkins (Ken), and his nephews Hunter, Hayden, Drew, Jeremy, and Judah Hawkins. He is preceded in death by his parents Lucien and Shirley Bonck. Graveside memorial services will be held on Friday April 21, 2023 at 11:30 am at Hope Mausoleum 4841 Canal St., New Orleans, LA 70119.

Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Gauley, Ruby

On April 12, 2023, Ruby Lee Ellender Gauley of Pearl River, Louisiana, went home to be with the Lord while surrounded by her family and in the comfort of her home. She was 94. Ruby was preceded in death by her husband, MV (Bill) Gauley, her daughter, Kay White, her parents, Adna and Edith (Little) Ellender, her sister, Belle Trahan, and brothers, Robert, Buddy and Roy Ellender. Ruby was born February 19, 1929, in Hackberry, Louisiana, where she grew up “on the island” and graduated at age 16 from Hackberry High School. She went on to graduate from Business College in Lake Charles. From there she started her first job at Shell Oil Co, also in Lake Charles, where she met Bill Gauley, a Western Union employee, when he fixed her teletype machine. After their marriage, she moved with him to his hometown, Pearl River. They built their home and raised four successful children, Jo Lynn McQueen (Ralph), Lisa Kay White, Tammi Edith Fandal (Boo), and Bill Kevin Gauley (Karen). Ruby and Bill leave behind a wonderful legacy through their grandchildren, Heather Benton, Matt McQueen, Danielle Nelson, Jessica Gauley, Marcee Pirie, Aimee Reid, Bill Gauley, and Hillary Nelson; and their great grandchildren, Noah, Rain, Luke, Peyton, Levi, Ella, Hadassah, Layla, Madeline, Ruby Lee, and Miles. She is also survived by her sister, Delores McQueen.

Ruby became involved in her new community immediately as a founding member of the local Women’s Civic Club. She always loved Pearl River and the people of the town. After her children started school, she was actively involved for many years on the boards of the local PTAs and other local organizations. She was asked to teach Kindergarten for Sts. Peter and Paul Catholic Church and was very successful. After several years of teaching, she was asked to be Pearl River’s Town Clerk and Tax Collector. She got her education through local universities to become certified with the State of Louisiana as a Municipal Clerk. She was one of the first in the state. After retiring as Town Clerk, she decided she could do more for her people and ran for the office of Town Councilmember. She won each time by an overwhelming margin and also became the Mayor Pro Tem. She served eight years on the Council and founded the Pearl River and Honey Island Swamp Museum. Ruby felt local children were growing up without realizing the proud and interesting history of the town and she knew a good museum would really benefit both the children and adults of her community. The list of her accomplishments goes on, but if you knew her, you know she was a tireless worker who shied away from any credit or accolades. Her warmth and willingness to help anyone and everyone will be remembered and cherished forever. She was a faithful servant of her Lord and Savior, and she was a member of New Jerusalem Church (now Generations) for several decades.

A Celebration of Ruby Gauley’s life will be held Saturday April 22, 2023, at Generations Church, Military Rd, Pearl River. Visitation will be from 9:30 am to 11:30 am with the Funeral service starting at 11:30 am. Interment to follow at Gauley Family Cemetery, McQueen Rd, Pearl River. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, is in charge of arrangements.

Gornor, John "Herbie"

John “Herbie” Gornor 1936 – 2023

On Sunday April 2, 2023, John Herbert Gornor passed away at the age of 86, surrounded by family and friends in the comfort of his home. John was born on September 25, 1936, in New Orleans, LA. He lived most of his life in Pearl River, LA. At the age of 18 he enlisted into the U.S. Army serving from 1954 – 1957. Two of those years were spent in Korea. John was a longtime employee of Washington-St. Tammany Electric Co-Op & Lockheed Martin. He enjoyed hog hunting from horseback in the pineywoods of St. Tammany Parish. After retirement, he loved to travel with long time friends; Paul, Wilda, John & Margaret Harper as far as Alaska in the R.V, to Nova Scotia on the ferry. Gardening & spending time with grandchildren and great grandchildren were the icing on the cake for him. He is survived by his 5 children: Herbert Gornor (Angela), Doris Beatty (Rick), Edwin Gornor Sr., Donna Lynn Whaley (Chris), James Gornor (Katie), 19 grandchildren: Chris, Stephanie, Katie, Kenny, Zach, Madyson, Danessa, Davy, Zoe, Eddie, Tina, Theresa, Missy, Tara, Kyle, Madalynn, Ali, Jamee, Bo & 24 great grandchildren. He is preceded in death by his parents Louis and Josie Gonor, 2 children Catherine & Kenny Gornor, 1 grandchild Jason Gornor and his beloved wife of 30 years Juanita Gornor. Memorial Services for Mr. Gornor will be held on Saturday April 22, 2023 at 10:30 am, First Baptist Church 64541 LA-1081 Pearl River, LA 70452.

Monroe, Timmy

On Sunday April 2, 2023, Timmy Deon Monroe, of Slidell, La passed away at the age of 64. Timmy served in the United States Navy for 4 years as an Engineman and was a Hydraulic Tech for many years after the military. He is survived by his brothers Lauren Wayne Monroe and Milford Ray Monroe, and his nieces and nephews, April Vaughn, Michelle Rizan, Desiree Monroe, Dennis Monroe, Trevor Ray Monroe, and Jeffrey Caleb Monroe. He is now reunited in the presence of the Lord with his parents Irvin and Isabell Monroe, and his siblings Steve Edward Monroe and Terry Willis Monroe. Graveside services will be held on Wednesday April 5, 2023, at 10 am at Hickory Memorial Gardens Cemetery, located at Williams Funeral Home 67525 Hwy 41, Pearl River, LA. 70452. Brother Danny Williams, Jr. to be officiating.

Amanda Harrison

On Wednesday March 15, 2023, Amanda Lea Harrison, age 36 of Slidell, LA passed away unexpectedly. Amanda was a loving and devoted daughter, fiancée, sister, friend, but most importantly a mother to her beautiful 6 month old son. She loved collecting and trading colorstreet nails. She will be missed dearly. Amanda is survived by her mother Barbara Dazet, her fiancée David Lee Robinson, her son Christopher Lee Robinson, brother Dennis Joseph Harrison, Jr. (Ginny), her grandfather Vincent DiCrispino, her nephews, cousins, and many friends. She is preceded in death by her father Dennis Joseph Harrison, Sr., and her grandparents Evelyn DiCrispino, Donald Harrison, and Mildred Harrison. Her bright light will shine on through all she leaves behind. Memorial Services will be held on Saturday April 1, 2023 from 3 pm to 7 pm with service starting at 4:30 pm from the chapel of Williams Funeral Home 67525 Hwy 41 Pearl River, LA 70452.

Brian Shinault

Brian Wayne Shinault, age 47 of New Orleans, LA passed away unexpectedly on Sunday March 26, 2023. He was a graduate of Southern University Law Center and Tulane University where he passed the bar. He is survived by his daughter Amber Shinault and three grandchildren Karon, Nova, and Titan, whom he loved with his whole heart. He is also survived by his mother, Sharon LaBiche and bonus dad William LaBiche, Sr., his brother Wayne Shinault, William LaBiche, Jr. (Molly) and sister Cher Shinault. He is preceded in death by his dad Allen Wayne Shinault. He will be missed dearly by all who knew him. Memorial Services for Brian will be held on Friday March 31, 2023, at 2 pm with visitation from 12 pm until 4 pm, from the chapel of Williams Funeral Home 67525 Hwy 41 Pearl River, LA 70452.

Kastner, Shirley

On Monday, March 20, 2023, Shirley Trascher Kastner, age 87 of Slidell, LA, went peacefully to be with our Lord surrounded by her loving family. She was a devoted Christian who through her loving ways, instilled by Christ’s Love, has touched many lives, which will forever be changed. She adored God’s children as she served as a Sunday School Teacher for 40 years at Prince of Peace Lutheran Church in New Orleans and Village Lutheran Church in Lacombe. Her legacy of Love for Christ will live on through her beloved family, of all whose lives she touched. Mrs. Shirley is survived by her dear husband of 70 years Ralph J. Kastner, Jr., her children Rickey J. Kastner, Sr. (Peggy), Lee Kastner Ducote, Ralph J. Kastner, Sr. (Brenda), and Christine Kastner Greer (Monte), her Beloved grandchildren; Angelle Kastner Betzer (Craig), Ralph J. Kastner, Jr. (Danielle), Amy Kastner Barrios (Charles), Gena Kastner Daley (Paul), Danielle Ducote Crane (Rick), Brandon Carlone, Rickey J. Kastner, Jr. (Brittany), and Stephanie Greer Camp (Daniel), and her 17 great grandchildren. She is preceded in death by her loving parents, Cecelia and Conrad Trascher, her sister Cecelia “Grace” Howard, her son in law Jessie J. Ducote, Sr., and her grandson Jessie James Ducote. The family requests in lieu of flowers that donations to St. Jude Children’s Hospital be made in her name. She was a strong advocate for St. Jude’s Hospital. Memorial Services will be held on Saturday, March 25, 2023, at 12 pm with visitation from 10 am until service time at Village Church-Lutheran 29180 U.S. Hwy 190, Lacombe, LA 70445. Reception to follow immediately after the service in the fellowship hall. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Dorothy Lee Danner Jamison

On Sunday March 12, 2023, Dorothy Lee Jamison, age 96 of Pearl River, LA went peacefully to be with our Lord in the comfort of her own home. Dorothy was a faithful parishioner of St. Margaret Mary Catholic Church for many years. She enjoyed shopping and attending church as her favorite past times. She will be missed dearly. Mrs. Dorothy is survived by her sons Patrick Wayne Jamison (Mary) and David Earl Jamison (Linda), her sister-in-law Edna Walters, her grandchildren Bo Patrick Jamison, Shelly Lee Ryan, and Kevin David Jamison, Step Grandson Raymond Lee Raby, and her great grandchildren; Brooke Shaun, Ian, Eli, Savannah, and Stella. She is now reunited in Heaven with her husband RB Jamison, her parents Charlie and Pearl Danner, and her siblings Ray Danner and Anna Mae Baine. Funeral services for Dorothy will be held at a later date at Milner and Orr Funeral Home 1079 Court St., Wickliffe, KY 42087.

Fisher, Janet

On Thursday March 3, 2023, Janet Wild Fisher, age 69 of Pearl River, La passed away peacefully to be with our Lord. She loved cooking, coloring, doing puzzles, and her favorite past time of being with her babies (grandkids). She will be missed greatly by everyone who knew her. Mrs. Janet is survived by her husband Patrick Fisher, her daughter Patti Blackwell (Zack), her sister Mary Polk, several grandchildren, and her nephew Danny Polk. She is now rejoicing with her family that has left this world before her including her parents August and Katherine Wild, and her precious daughters Aimee Guillory and Stacey Singletary. Williams Funeral Home 67525 Hwy 41, Pearl River, LA 70452 in charge of arrangements.

Slaydon, Robert

On Sunday February 26, 2023, Robert Slaydon, age 81 of Slidell, LA passed away peacefully. Mr. Slaydon was a welder in the construction industry for many years. He loved working on vehicles, making moonshine, and making trouble. Robert is survived by his children Bobby Chambers, Michael Chambers, Melissa Schulze, and Charlotte McCollum whom he raised as his own, his siblings; Jerry Slaydon, Clara Uhry, William Slaydon, Opal Dickerson, and Sheila Barnes, his grandchildren; Carley, Cody, Brandon, Rene, Alyson, Robert, Jr., Joshua, Lindsay, Brittany, Brooke, Alexus, and, Patrick, and his great grandchildren; Anzleigh, Lilleigh, Kinleigh, Riley, and Amethyst. He is preceded in death by his parents Andrew and Lillian Slaydon, and his siblings; Gary Slaydon, Archie Slaydon, and Shirley Miller. He will be greatly missed. A Celebration of his life will be held at a later date. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Zimmermann, Jr., Ronald

On Friday February 24, 2023, Ronald James Zimmermann, Jr., age 55 of Slidell, LA passed away. Ronald enjoyed building stereos and working in the window tinting industry. He is survived by his father Ronald James Zimmermann, Sr., his step-mom’s Tessie Zimmermann and Pam Zimmermann, his son Colby Compagno, siblings; Melissa Ann Nicol, Ashley Zimmermann, Carrie Mismash, Michael Jenny Jr., Heather Jenny, Amber Jenny, and Ashley Holmes, step brother Ryan Zimmermann, and his girlfriend Monica Jerez. He is preceded in death by his mother Nelia Steerman, and his grandparents. No services are scheduled at this time. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Arriaza, Elizabeth

On Tuesday February 21, 2023, Elizabeth Arriaza, age 73 of Slidell, LA passed away peacefully. Elizabeth was a retired Beautician who loved to make people smile. She Leaves behind to cherish her memory her children; Cesar Arriaza (Hope) and Adrianne Matthews (Walter), stepchildren Sandra Quakenbush (Jim) and Patricia Motley (Jim), her grandchildren; Vincent Chatelain, Rebekah Arriaza, Louis Rodriguez, Alex Matthews, Sophia Matthews, Lauren Johnson, Rachel Quakenbush, Taylor Motley, and Morgan Motley, 5 great grandchildren Wyatt and Gemma Robichaux, Tristan Johnson, Austin Johnson, and Addison Johnson, and her siblings Gloria Cruz, Sergio Enriquez, Abraham Enriquez and Noemi Fasan. She is now reunited with her husband Cesar Arriaza. She will be missed greatly. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Kolovitz, Barbara

On Sunday February 26, 2023 Barbara Yvonne Kolovitz, age 60 of Pearl River, LA passed away in her own home surrounded by her loving family. Barbara enjoyed spending time with her family and antiquing in her free time. Mrs. Barbara is survived by her children; Jessica Seal, Brian Rowland, and Greta Kolovitz, her mother Phyllis Hammer Mandot, her siblings; Paul Mandot, Jr., Marcella Mandot, Sylvia Kennedy, Dennis Mandot, and Teeny Beiser, 3 grandchildren Caleb Pawless, Chloe Pawless, and James Seal, and 3 great grandchildren Dean, Leilani, and Adalynn. She is preceded in death by her husband Kenneth Kolovitz, and her father Paul Mandot, Sr. Memorial Services will be held at a later date. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Roy, Kenny

On Monday February 20, 2023, Kenny Roy, age 66 of Pearl River, LA passed away peacefully in the comfort of his own home surrounded by his loving family. Mr. Kenny loved to fish in his spare time, and enjoyed being around and with friends and family as much as he could. He was well liked at his job as an A/C Mechanic for the School Board for the last 19 yrs. Mr. Roy is survived by his loving wife Sharon Roy, his children Jason Roy (Sherry), Abagail Moore (Chase), and Zachary Roy, his sister Doris Polk, and his 6 grandchildren; Sophia, Stella, and Noah Moore, and Carsen, Cohen and Charley Roy. Mr. Roy is also survived by a host of nieces, nephews, extended family, and friends. He is preceded in death by his parents Conna and Frankie Roy, and his siblings Jimmy Roy and Sue Brady. He will be missed dearly, but his legacy will live on through all he leaves behind. Williams Funeral Home, Pearl River, LA in charge of arrangements.

Robbins, Lenord

On Saturday February 25, 2023, Lenord Ray Robbins, age 65 of Pearl River, LA passed away peacefully in the comfort of his home. Lenord was a 1975 graduate of Pearl River High School where he was 4th in his class, he worked for Bellsouth for 15 years, and then on to Office Depot for 10 years. He loved to travel all around the world any chance he could get. He is survived by his mother Lou Edith Robbins, his siblings Edith Darlene Robbins Pitts (Jonathan) and Anthony Keith Robbins, and a host of Aunts, Uncles, and Cousins. He is now in the presence of the Lord with his dad Oscar Robbins, and his grandparents. Funeral Services for Lenord will be held on Thursday March 2, 2023 at 1 pm with visitation from 11 am until service time at Williams Funeral Home 67525 Hwy 41 Pearl River, LA 70452. Interment to follow at Hickory Memorial Gardens Cemetery, Pearl River, LA.

Forbis, Marion "Norris"

Marion “Norris” Magee Forbis was born on June 24, 1949, in Franklinton, Louisiana and passed away on February 17, 2023, in Slidell, Louisiana at the age of 73 after a short illness. Norris was preceded in death by his mother, Mildred Magee Bell and his father, Woodrow W. Magee, Sr. He was also preceded in death by his siblings Woodrow W. Taylor, Sr., Sandra L. Magee and husband, Louis, Kathy Bell Forbis and former husband, Kenneth, Sr., and Karen Bell Jeffers and cousin, Bob Rigdon. McPherson, Ellis

On Sunday October 16, 2022 Ellis McPherson, age 90 of Pearl River, LA passed away peacefully in the comfort of his own home. Mr. Ellis was born in Epps, LA on September 5, 1932, to Glovis and Ida McPherson. Ellis was a Pearl River High School Alumni where he was inducted into the hall of fame on May 18, 1995. He was one of the many people who helped get the Athletic Program established when Pearl River High School opened in 1968. Mr. McPherson served proudly in the United States Army during the Korean War and went on the become an Iron Worker for the Local 58 out of New Orleans, LA. until he retired. Ellis loved his family, coon hunting, and fishing as his many hobbies. One of the many things he thoroughly enjoyed was watching LSU play and NFL football. In 1973 he received 3rd place for National Coon Hunters Association World Championship High Scoring Tree Dog. He also received many other state championship awards through the years for Coon Hunting. The “Pearl River River” itself knew him intimately. The river was the other “love” of his life. It is where he found a very special peace. He will be missed deeply by family and the “Old River”. Mr. Ellis is now rejoicing in Heaven with his wife of 68 years Sally B. McPherson, his parents Glovis and Ida McPherson, his children Steve McPherson and Cindy Bilbo, and his siblings; Gladis, Ray, his sisters Opal Ann Guerro, Betty Jean Carrol, Alice Faye Harrell, Vera Harris, Jewel Hoover, Myrtle Cannon, and James McPherson. He is survived by his children who stood by his side till the end; Stanley McPherson, Debbie Todd, Robin Kenerly, and Lisa Thompson, 13 grandchildren and 20 great grandchildren.

Visitation for Mr. Ellis will be held on Thursday October 20, 2022 from 10 am to 11 am with the funeral starting at 11 am at Williams Funeral Home 67525 hwy 41 Pearl River, LA 70452. Interment to follow at Hickory Memorial Gardens Cemetery, Pearl River, LA.
